tool.name: Annotation Table Generator
tool.description: from a set of input BlastXML results, automatically filling in Hypothetical Novels
tool.command:
bin/cpt_at_table2.pl --galaxy --outfile_supporting $__new_file_path__ #for $item in $repeat_file: --file "${item.file}" #end for
#for $item in $repeat_label: --label "${item.label}" #end for
--genome "${genome}"
--dice_cutoff "${dice_cutoff}"
--evalue_cutoff "${evalue_cutoff}"
--lookahead "${lookahead}"
#if $disable_auto_hypothetical_novels: --disable_auto_hypothetical_novels #end if
#if $full: --full #end if
--annotation_table "${annotation_table}"
--annotation_table_files_path "${annotation_table.files_path}"
--annotation_table_format "${annotation_table_format}"
--annotation_table_id "${annotation_table.id}"

param.name: label
param.help: Sheet name which corresponds to a given file
param.label: label

param.name: disable_auto_hypothetical_novels
param.help: Disable the automatic labelling of hypothetical novels from Blast XML files based on the listing of Hits and Genes. If your FASTA header lines do not match your `/gene` tag in your `/products`, then you should set this flag
param.label: disable_auto_hypothetical_novels

param.name: full
param.help: Use Full output instead of Light output
param.label: full

tool.help:
NAME ====
Annotation Table Generator
DESCRIPTION ===========
This script merges a number of CSV formatted blast hits, and produces an "annotation table" from that data. This annotation table consists of human-readable tabular blast results and the core annotation sheet which is used by students to record their putative gene assignments based on blast (and other) data.
